org.cougaar.core.plugin.deletion
Interface DeletionPolicy

All Known Implementing Classes:
DeletionPolicyBase, SimpleDeletionPolicy
public interface DeletionPolicy

A policy that controls the timing of the deletion of a blackboard object. A predicate checks for the applicability of the policy to the object. The priority disambiguates the case where multiple policies might apply. The deletionDelay supplies an additional delay before the object is actually deleted

Field Summary
static int MAX_PRIORITY
          The maximum allowable priority for any policy.
static int MIN_PRIORITY
          The minimum allowable priority for any non-default policy.
static long NO_DELETION_DELAY
          A value signifying that the policy has no defined delay.
static int NO_PRIORITY
          A priority guaranteed to be less than any defined priority.
 
Method Summary
 long getDeletionDelay()
          Get the additional delay (in scenario time) that should be inserted before a blackboard object is deleted.
 java.lang.String getName()
          Get the name of this policy.
 UnaryPredicate getPredicate()
          Get the predicate for this policy.
 int getPriority()
          Get the priority of this policy over other deletion policies.
 

Field Detail

NO_DELETION_DELAY

static final long NO_DELETION_DELAY
A value signifying that the policy has no defined delay. If the applicable policy has such a value, deletion does not occur.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

NO_PRIORITY

static final int NO_PRIORITY
A priority guaranteed to be less than any defined priority. Only the default policy has NO_PRIORITY. Real policies should have a minimum of MIN_PRIORITY.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

MIN_PRIORITY

static final int MIN_PRIORITY
The minimum allowable priority for any non-default policy.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

MAX_PRIORITY

static final int MAX_PRIORITY
The maximum allowable priority for any policy.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Get the name of this policy. The name is arbitrary and only used in user interfaces, if any.

Returns:
the name of the policy.

getPredicate

UnaryPredicate getPredicate()
Get the predicate for this policy. The predicate should return true when applied to objects to which this policy applies.

Returns:
the predicate selecting objects for which this policy applies.

getDeletionDelay

long getDeletionDelay()
Get the additional delay (in scenario time) that should be inserted before a blackboard object is deleted.

Returns:
the number of milliseconds of delay before deletion.

getPriority

int getPriority()
Get the priority of this policy over other deletion policies. When multiple policies match an object the highest priority policy is used.

Returns:
the priority of this policy.
